page.title: 09COMBERTON'S BUILDINGS
page.content: The oldest house in Comberton is the vicarage where the vicar lives. It was built in the fifteenth century which makes it five hundred years old. The newest house in Comberton is on the road called Green End. It was built in the twentieth century, the century we are in now, which makes it about one month old. There are two estates in Comberton, Janes and Kentings. Janes, the oldest estate was so called because the builders who built it were called Janes. Kentings estate was called that because the land was known as Kenting's Land. From the centre of the village by the duck pond you can see lots of houses. Houses with thatched roofs, half timbered walls and spread foundations.
